author: Lorenzo Briotti
title: Papa Francesco, il bollettino: "Non √® fuori pericolo, ha ancora la polmonite. Vuole che si dica la verit√†"
text:
‚ÄúIl Papa non √® fuori pericolo‚Äù. A dirlo √® il professor Sergio Alfieri in un briefing all‚Äôospedale Gemelli, dove ha aggiornato la stampa sulla salute di Papa Francesco attraverso un nuovo bollettino. ‚ÄúAdesso non √® in pericolo di vita, oggi √® andato in cappella a pregare‚Äù, ha detto Alfieri. E a proposito della sua salute, il medico ha spiegato che ‚Äúil Papa ha sempre voluto che dicessimo la verit√†‚Äù.
Il Pontefice, da venerd√¨ scorso, √® in trattamento per una bronchite e una polmonite bilaterale che ha ancora. Negli ultimi giorni i medici hanno registrato un lieve miglioramento. I prossimi saranno fondamentali per capire i tempi del ricovero. Al momento, per√≤, non esiste una tempistica certa sulla sua guarigione. Secondo i medici che lo hanno in cura rester√† infatti in ospedale almeno per tutta la prossima settimana. ‚ÄúDobbiamo essere concentrati a superare questa fase qui. Vediamo la tempra del Santo Padre, non √® una persona che molla‚Äù, ha aggiunto Alfieri.
Bergoglio non √® attaccato a nessun macchinario. Il vero rischio, sottolinea ancora lo specialista, √® per√≤ la sepsi: ‚ÄúIl vero rischio √® se i germi passano nel sangue. Oggi non ci sono questi germi nel sangue. L‚Äôinfezione ora √® solo nel polmone. Questo √® il vero rischio che pu√≤ correre una persona della sua et√†‚Äù, ha detto ancora il medico. Fortunatamente, l‚Äôinfezione del Santo Padre √® contenuta e gli √® stato anche ridotto qualche farmaco.
Papa Francesco, il bollettino: ‚ÄúNon √® fuori pericolo, ha ancora la polmonite. Vuole che si dica la verit√†‚Äù (foto Ansa) ‚Äì Blitz Quotidiano ‚ÄúQuando ha bisogno mette i naselli per un po‚Äô di ossigeno, ma sta a respiro spontaneo e si alimenta‚Äù, ha detto ancora Alfieri, che poi ha aggiunto: ‚ÄúIl Papa √® di buonumore e fa battute. L‚Äôaltro giorno gli ho detto: ‚ÄòBuongiorno Santo Padre‚Äô. E lui mi ha risposto: ‚ÄòBuon giorno santo figlio. Tanto per dire'‚Äù.

author: @LANACION
title: Mercados mexicanos avanzan tras comentarios powell, peso cierra por debajo de 20/dlr - LA NACION
text:
CIUDAD DE M√âXICO, 16 abr (Reuters) - El peso mexicano y la bolsa avanzaron el mi√©rcoles ante un debilitamiento global del d√≥lar y despu√©s de que el presidente de la Reserva Federal, Jerome Powell, afirm√≥ que el organismo esperar√≠a m√°s datos sobre la direcci√≥n de la econom√≠a antes de cambiar las tasas de inter√©s. En un discurso en el Club Econ√≥mico de Chicago, Powell habl√≥ de una situaci√≥n potencialmente dif√≠cil para el banco central estadounidense, en la que la inflaci√≥n se ve impulsada al alza por los aranceles, mientras que el crecimiento y posiblemente el empleo se debilitan.
* La divisa local culmin√≥ la sesi√≥n en 19.9200 unidades, con una ganancia de un 0.89% frente a los 20.0990 pesos del precio de referencia de LSEG del martes, su mejor nivel de cierre desde el 3 de abril.
* "Luego de una baja generalizada del d√≥lar frente a la mayor√≠a de las monedas, los operadores asimilan los comentarios de Powell en el Club Econ√≥mico de Chicago, cualquier noticia sobre los aranceles de Trump y datos econ√≥micos en Estados Unidos", dijo la firma CIBanco en una nota de an√°lisis.
* Los inversionistas recibieron con buen √°nimo un s√≥lido de reporte del Producto Interno Bruto de China en el primer trimestre pese a las tensiones comerciales con Washington, mientras que las ventas al por menor crecieron m√°s de lo previsto en Estados Unidos en marzo.
* A nivel local destac√≥ que Fitch Ratings reiter√≥ la calificaci√≥n crediticia de M√©xico en "BBB-" con perspectiva "estable".
* El referencial √≠ndice burs√°til S&P/BMV IPC subi√≥ un 0.71% a 53,018.57 puntos, con un volumen de 168.2 millones de acciones negociadas, por debajo del promedio diario de unos 200 millones de los √∫ltimos meses, debido al periodo vacacional de Semana Santa.
* La bolsa hil√≥ tres sesiones consecutivas de ganancias.
* Los t√≠tulos de la minera Industrias Pe√±oles encabezaron las alzas del mi√©rcoles, con un 7.85% m√°s a 425.44 pesos, seguidos por los del operador del mercado burs√°til Grupo BMV, que sumaron un 3.90% a 38.59 pesos.
* En el mercado secundario de deuda, el rendimiento del bono a 10 a√±os ascendi√≥ seis puntos base a un 9.53%, mientras que la tasa a 20 a√±os avanz√≥ dos, a un 10.11%. (Reporte de No√© Torres)
LA NACION Temas

author: Shahadat Hossain Chowdhury
title: How AMMS Group becomes a logistic giant in 3 decades | The Business Standard
text: In a remarkable journey spanning three decades, Shafiqul Alam Jewel has steered the transformation of a family business into the largest logistics company in Bangladesh. Since his entry into the shipping sector in 1992, Shafiqul has played a pivotal role in shaping the success story of the AMMS Group. The evolution of AMMS Group reflects a strategic expansion into various facets of the logistics industry. Initially engaged in managing the Chattogram Port operations, the company has diversified its services to become a comprehensive logistics solution provider. Over the years, AMMS Group has seamlessly integrated shipping agency, stevedoring, custom clearance, inland transportation, equipment leasing, logistic support, doorstep delivery, ODC handling, and manpower management into its portfolio. This strategic approach has positioned AMMS Group as a one-stop logistics service provider in Bangladesh. The Chattogram-based business group has become a significant player in the logistics domain within the international market. With over 300 employees, the company is set to make new investments in environmentally friendly block construction starting from March next year, with a goal of producing one lakh blocks per day. The diverse business portfolio of the AMMS Group includes AMMS Logistic, Pearl Hotel, Radiant Shipping, Pearl Technical School, Cosmos Enterprise, Pearl Institute of Management, Pearl Height, and SS Enterprise. The company boasts a fleet comprising various goods transport vehicles, ranging from lighter ships, barges and prime movers. Notably, the fleet includes heavy machinery transport vehicles with a remarkable 350 tonnes cargo capacity, featuring 24 axles and 192 wheels. The last decade has seen AMMS Group actively contributing to key government fast-track projects, such as the Payra 1320 MW Thermal Power Plant, Matarbari 1200 MW Ultra Super Critical Coal Power Plant, Karnaphuli Tunnel Project, Ghorashal Polash Urea Fertiliser Project, Padma Bridge Rail Link Project, 3rd Terminal of Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport, BNS Sheikh Hasina Submarine Base Static Project, and the Bangladesh Navy Damage Control Simulator Project. The company has supplied heavy equipment, including self-propelled modular transporters, and cranes, along with engineering expertise for these projects. The heavy machinery imported from various countries plays a crucial role in the government's projects, in association with the AMMS Group, ensuring efficient transportation, goods delivery, and integrated transportation solutions. Additionally, AMMS Group plays a vital role in coal unloading operations at the Payra port. Amms Group Managing Director Shafiqul Alam Jewel, who is also the vice chairman of the Bangladesh Shipping Agents' Association, attributes the company's success to a unique combination of dynamic expertise derived from extensive experience and a consistent track record of performance. "With a focus on total client satisfaction, AMMS Logistics has emerged as the premier agency in the business of integrated logistics solutions, providing end-to-end services. The company's growth has been guided by a commitment to transformation, staying at the forefront of a complex logistics landscape to meet the growing demands of ship owners, traders, and ocean carriers," he said.

author: Michele Zunino
title: Data center e cloud, Zunino: ‚ÄúL‚ÄôItalia rischia di diventare una preda delle big tech‚Äù
text:
Analizzando le forze in campo in ambito di sviluppo cloud e sviluppo digitale tout court occorre evidenziare che, da una parte ci sono gli investimenti miliardari proclamati dalle big tech, che hanno messo nel mirino l‚ÄôEuropa meridionale e l‚ÄôItalia in particolare, dopo anni dedicati ai pi√π maturi mercati nel nord, e dall‚Äôaltra troviamo le tesi ‚Äìsempre pi√π diffuse e argomentate- a favore di una maggiore attenzione alla sovranit√† digitale, agli operatori locali e alla relativa filiera.
L‚Äôevoluzione dello scenario
L‚Äôultima ricerca dell‚ÄôOsservatorio del Politecnico di Milano calcola in 94 miliardi di dollari gli investimenti 2024 in Europa dei primi 8 cloud provider al mondo: il solo podio (saldamente occupato da Aws, Microsoft e Google) vale oltre il 65% dell‚Äôintero mercato continentale.
Il Prefetto Bruno Frattasi, a capo dell‚ÄôAgenzia per la Cybersicurezza Nazionale, nel contesto di ComoLake2024 ha sottolineato non solo la rilevanza per la sovranit√† a livello europeo, ma ha riaffermato l‚Äôimportanza di quella nazionale, anzi delle varie sovranit√† degli Stati membri, interpretandole come anelli di una catena che devono essere tutti resilienti per non creare falle nell‚Äôintero sistema.
Quello digitale √® evidentemente un sistema interconnesso, e credo che possiamo essere tutti d‚Äôaccordo sul fatto che un sistema omogeneo e produttivo √® costituito da elementi che operano all‚Äôinterno di un insieme di obiettivi e interessi comuni. Se cos√¨ non √®, il rischio √® che si tratti di agglomerati in cui alcuni organismi ricavano energie e nutrimento a discapito degli altri.
Quali sono gli interessi degli hyperscaler?
Al di l√† delle dichiarazioni, serve avere la lucidit√† di chiederci quali siano realmente gli interessi degli hyperscaler che annunciano grandi investimenti nel nostro Paese, quali saranno le effettive ricadute economiche e occupazionali sui territori teoricamente interessati dagli interventi, e quale sar√† la ricaduta industriale rispetto alle politiche di crescita del Paese. E avere la capacit√† analitica e l‚Äôonest√† intellettuale di dare a tutte queste domande una risposta inequivocabile: siamo di fronte a una strategia predatoria da parte di soggetti stranieri che, palesando una filosofia di cooperazione, stanno in realt√† depredando le risorse attuali e ipotecando la nostra capacit√† di sviluppo autonomo dei prossimi decenni.
L‚ÄôItalia rischia di diventare succube
I data center sono un business che di per s√© ha bisogno di pochissima forza lavoro, di competenze e tecnologie non particolarmente differenzianti. Sono le autostrade del digitale: necessarie, ma totalmente inutili in assenza di traffico veicolare. E invece √® proprio nel traffico che si genera il vero valore: fuori dalle infrastrutture di base, ma piuttosto nelle piattaforme ospitate all‚Äôinterno dei centri dati, nella potenza di calcolo espressa, nella capacit√† di memoria, ovvero in tutti quegli elementi che valorizzano le informazioni grezze e sono cos√¨ importanti anche in chiave di intelligenza artificiale. Su questi elementi rischiamo di essere estromessi e di rimanere succubi dei pochi che li dominano, anche sfruttando i nostri dati ‚Äì o comunque avendo in mano le chiavi di accesso al nostro posto.
√à fondamentale che la politica acquisisca la piena consapevolezza su questa prospettiva, che sia in grado di leggere con chiarezza e lungimiranza il fenomeno e pi√π in generale i fondamentali di questo mercato, spina dorsale del progresso economico, sociale e civile del nostro tempo. L‚Äôindipendenza digitale √® infatti un tema regolatorio e di politica industriale di livello nazionale e sovranazionale: se ne discute nei Parlamenti nazionali e a Bruxelles, in commissioni dedicate agli ambiti pi√π diversi, che vanno dal procurement della PA all‚Äôistruzione, dallo sviluppo economico alla privacy. Ne scrivono i giornali; arriva fino all‚Äôopinione pubblica, soprattutto in caso di spettacolari cyber-incidenti dalle conseguenze globali.
Il parere degli esperti
Il Professor Roberto Baldoni, che ha guidato l‚ÄôAgenzia nazionale per la cybersecurity prima di Frattasi, ha scritto un libro sul tema, a breve disponibile in italiano: ‚ÄúCharting Digital Sovereignty: a Survival Playbook. How to assess and to improve the level of digital sovereignty of a country‚Äù. La considera un obiettivo da perseguire, nonostante le difficolt√† di una ‚Äúdeglobalizzazione‚Äù sotto il profilo della gestione dei dati.
Ne parla anche Mario Draghi nel recente rapporto sulla competitivit√† dell‚ÄôUE: pur sostenendo che alcuni settori tech siano andati ‚Äúperduti‚Äù nella competizione con i colossi extraeuropei (tesi a mio avviso felicemente controvertibile) afferma la necessit√† per le imprese europee di mantenere una presenza ‚Äúin aree in cui la sovranit√† tecnologica √® un requisito, come sicurezza e crittografia (soluzioni di cloud sovrano)‚Äù. L‚Äôimpostazione non stupisce, essendo stato proprio il Governo Draghi a redigere la Strategia Nazionale di Cybersicurezza 2022-26 basandola, tra le altre cose, sul conseguimento dell‚Äô‚Äùautonomia nazionale strategica nel settore‚Äù e considerandola ‚Äúcome un investimento e un fattore abilitante per lo sviluppo dell‚Äôeconomia e dell‚Äôindustria nazionale, al fine di accrescere la competitivit√† del Sistema-Paese a livello globale‚Äù.
L‚ÄôAd di Leonardo ed ex Ministro, Roberto Cingolani ha affrontato in pi√π occasioni il tema dell‚Äôindipendenza digitale, sostenendola in chiave di posizionamento strategico per lo sviluppo competitivo di un‚Äôindustria italiana che si voglia protagonista nella difesa, nell‚Äôaerospazio, nell‚Äôintelligenza artificiale. In audizione alla Camera, pochi mesi fa, ha affermato che se √® vero che l‚ÄôItalia pu√≤ contare su un eccellente livello accademico e una potenza di calcolo complessiva tutto sommato competitiva, deve invece attrezzarsi sul fronte della capacit√† di memoria con un cloud nazionale, per garantire lo storage richiesto dagli algoritmi avanzati.
L‚Äôindipendenza digitale √® diventata una buzzword
L‚Äôindipendenza digitale √® diventata una buzzword. Il rischio √® quello di considerarla un concetto teorico, che non regge nella pratica di fronte allo strapotere delle big tech, delle loro inarrivabili economie di scala e degli standard di mercato da loro resi prevalenti.
Non √® cos√¨. Esistono aziende italiane di eccellenza lungo tutta la filiera. Queste operano, anche in ottica collaborativa e federata, garantendo la massima sicurezza, affidabilit√† e resilienza dei sistemi. Esistono competenze distintive nel nostro Paese, con talenti riconosciuti e apprezzati in tutto il mondo. La nostra politica industriale di lungo termine ha il dovere di mettere al centro questo fattore. Anche la commessa pubblica, attualmente orientata verso i grandi operatori stranieri, reindirizzandosi all‚Äôinterno per una quota parte significativa, rientrerebbe in questa logica di valorizzazione, generando un circolo virtuoso strutturale.
Gli effetti della promozione della sovranit√† digitale
La promozione della sovranit√† digitale pu√≤ portare anche a iniziative di formazione e sviluppo, favorendo l‚Äôadozione delle tecnologie emergenti. Non √® un caso che anche in questo campo gli hyperscaler si stiano muovendo, offrendo programmi di formazione digitale a studenti anche pre-universitari: ricordiamoci che le competenze sulle quali vengono formati oggi i talenti determineranno le scelte dei futuri leader. L‚Äôautonomia digitale non limita le opzioni di scelta, anzi le amplifica, supportando una maggiore flessibilit√† e contrastando i lock-in, mentali ancora prima che tecnologici.
Viviamo in un mondo iperconnesso, ma altamente instabile, anche sul fronte degli approvvigionamenti di materie prime, tra cui le infrastrutture digitali. Appoggiarsi a un‚Äôinfrastruttura nazionale robusta e sicura e puntare su un‚Äôinnovazione gestita a livello nazionale aumenta la resilienza contro le crisi globali e le interferenze esterne, consentendo al Paese di proteggere i propri interessi in un contesto geopolitico in evoluzione. Oggi, la visione di un mondo senza confini fisici e digitali √® in via di ripensamento e deve trovare un punto di equilibrio e un valido compromesso, una via possibile alla ‚Äúdeglobalizzazione‚Äù. Il ruolo della politica √® quello di riconoscerlo con coraggio e visione, guidandoci nel percorso.

author: Devon Banfield
title: ‚ÄòThank you Mother Nature,‚Äô GTA residents share stunning photos of the northern lights last night
text:
If you live in the GTA, you may have noticed last night‚Äôs sky was a little more colourful than usual. That‚Äôs due to the aurora borealis, also known as the northern lights.
The natural spectacle dazzled many people across North America in the late hours of Oct. 10 and the wee hours of Oct. 11.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sahil Bajaj (@sammybajajoninsta)
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Niharika Singh & Austin Paul (@nikatin_canada)
Online, people in the GTA and beyond have been sharing the beauty they witnessed in the sky, with many people sharing that it was their first time seeing the natural display.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sweta | Toronto blogger (@torontofoodtales)
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Canada Bandi ‡∞ï‡±Ü‡∞®‡∞°‡∞æ ‡∞¨‡∞Ç‡∞°‡∞ø (@canadabandi)
‚ÄúThe Northern Lights showed up in Southern Ontario and pretty much the rest of the continent last night,‚Äù one person posted on X.
The Northern Lights showed up in Southern Ontario and pretty much the rest of the continent last night pic.twitter.com/jalOvtwkLj
‚Äî Jason O'Young (@jasonoyoung) October 11, 2024 I still can't believe I saw this in my city! #northernlights in London, Ontario. pic.twitter.com/fkNPAjtVJv
‚Äî Jen (@JenniferStuber) October 11, 2024 ‚ÄúIncredible. Something I never thought I‚Äôd see in a million years in southern Ontario. The Northern lights over Lake Ontario,‚Äù another person posted.
Incredible. Something I never thought I‚Äôd see in a million years in southern Ontario. The Northern lights over Lake Ontario. #bucketlist #nothernlights #auroraborealis #portcredit #mississauga #lakeontario pic.twitter.com/tZIPS3mV6T
‚Äî Julie Grant (@Jubels13) October 11, 2024 ‚ÄúStepped outside my front door just now and went for a walk. It was worth it. Such beauty. Thank you Mother Nature.‚Äù
Stepped outside my front door just now and went for a walk. It was worth it. Such beauty. Thank you Mother Nature. #northernlights #Ontario üá®üá¶‚òÆÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/5oD6fIaJel
‚Äî Jill Davis (@Jdavis_Halton) October 11, 2024 Couldn‚Äôt believe how visible these were from my balcony in Toronto ‚Äì especially considering how many bright lights we have in the parking lot. They were visible with the naked eye. Stunning colours! @weathernetwork #showyourweather #nothernlights #Auroraborealis pic.twitter.com/VEg35ohi1V
‚Äî Lindsay (@tebe482) October 11, 2024 WHAT ARE THE NORTHERN LIGHTS? While the term northern lights may cause your mind to conjure up images of colourful mirages in the night sky, do you know what causes this beautiful spectacle?
These colourful displays are seen in the northern hemisphere as the result of particles charged by the Sun creating a solar wind, which is redirected around the planet by a shield created by the Earth‚Äôs magnetic field.
‚ÄúAs Earth‚Äôs magnetic field protects us from the solar wind, the magnetic field lines are dragged and stretched. They snap back like an elastic band, launching charged particles down towards Earth‚Äôs surface along the magnetic field lines,‚Äù the Canadian government‚Äôs website explains .
We then see auroras happen when these particles come into contact with gasses in the upper atmosphere, creating small flashes that fill the night sky with colourful light. While auroras that happen in the north hemisphere are called aurora borealis, those in the southern hemisphere are called aurora australis.
The dancing effect of the aurora happens when tons of flashes happen in sequence.
The federal government says this natural wonder can be seen almost every night in the northern sky, from August to May. However, aurora borealis is most common near the spring and fall equinoxes.
So, why do we see the lights in northern Canada?
‚ÄúBecause of how space connects down to the ground,‚Äù the Canadian Space Agency‚Äôs web page explains.
‚ÄúThe part of space where most of the ‚Äòdragging, stretching, and snapping‚Äô happens is connected by magnetic fields down to the north and south ends of Earth. Because of the shape of Earth‚Äôs magnetic field, these magnetic field lines create two ovals of aurora around the North and South Poles.‚Äù
The colours of the northern lights are determined by various factors , including the makeup of gasses in Earth‚Äôs atmosphere, the density of the atmosphere, the amount of energy involved, and the altitude where the aurora happens.
The Canadian government has a plethora of information about the aurora borealis, including how to view the lights and capture good pictures .

author: @thetechchat
title: Lenovo's Yoga Slim 9i is the beauty, HP's OmniBook Ultra is the beast
text:
Table of Contents Table of Contents Specs and configurations Design Performance Display Portability Beauty or the beast? That‚Äôs your choice
Sometimes, a couple of laptops come along that fall into the same category but aim at very different things. In the 14-inch laptop space, the Lenovo Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10 and the HP OmniBook Ultra 14 are two such machines.
Where the Yoga Slim 9i is aimed at being really great looking and really thin and light, the OmniBook Ultra 14 wants to be bolder and brawnier. Both approaches have their charms, but which is right for you?
Recommended Videos Specs and configurations Lenovo Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10 HP OmniBook Ultra 14 Dimensions 12.31 x 8.01 x 0.57 inches 12.41 inches x 8.96 inches x 0.65 inches Weight 2.76 pounds 3.47 pounds CPU Intel Core Ultra 7 256V
Intel Core Ultra 7 258V AMD Ryzen AI 9 365
AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 GPU Intel Arc 140V AMD Radeon 890M RAM 16GB
32GB 16GB
32GB Display 14.0-inch 4K+ (3840 x 2400) OLED, 120Hz 14.0-inch 16:10 2.2K (2240 x 1400) IPS, 60Hz Storage 1TB SSD 512GB SSD
1TB SSD
2TB SSD Ports 2 x USB-C with Thunderbolt 4 2 x USB-C with Thunderbolt 4
1 x USB-A 3.2
1 x 3.5mm audio jack Touch Yes Yes Wireless Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetoth 5.4 Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetooth 5.4 Webcam 32MP with infrared camera for Windows 11 Hello 9MP with infrared camera for Windows 11 Hello Battery 75 watt-hour 68 watt-hour Operating system Windows 11 Windows 11 Price $1,760+ $1,350+ Rating 4 out of 5 stars 3.5 out of 5 stars Related Best Lenovo laptop deals: Save on Yoga and ThinkPad laptops Lenovo‚Äôs latest laptop had an edge on the MacBook Air until this week The Lenovo Legion 9i is a 10 out of 10 gaming laptop, and it‚Äôs on sale Right now, the Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10 has just two configurations. You can get an Intel Core Ultra 7 256V chipset, 16GB of RAM, and a 1TB SSD for $1,760, and for $1,835 you get the faster Core Ultra 7 258V and 32GB of RAM. The 14.0-inch 4K+ OLED display is the only option.
The OmniBook Ultra 14 has more options. For $1,350, you get an AMD Ryzen AI 9 365 chipset, 16GB of RAM, a 512GB SSD, and a 14.0-inch 2.2K IPS panel (the only option). Upgrading to a Ryzen AI 9 HD 375 and 32GB of RAM adds $150, while a 2TB SSD costs an additional $180. That makes them most expensive configuration $1,680.
The HP is therefore the more affordable of the two machines, without the sale prices that will inevitably arrive for both laptops. And, both are solidly in the premium category.
Design Mark Coppock / Digital Trends Looking at these two laptops side by side, and it‚Äôs obvious that they‚Äôre going for completely different vibes. The Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10 has smooth, rounded edges, a consistent dark blue color way (except for a slightly distracting bright blue keyboard), a glass cover on the lid that gives of a subtle sheen, and is generally a laptop that gleams a bit. The OmniBook Ultra 14 has a brawnier look, with HP‚Äôs now-iconic notches cut in the bottom display corners and the rear chassis edges, a dark gray color way that‚Äôs less elegant (but still attractive), and speaker grills flanking a slightly darker keyboard. The result is a laptop that‚Äôs also good looking, but doesn‚Äôt stand out nearly as much.
That‚Äôs also reflect in their relative sizes. The Yoga Slim 9i has insanely small bezels, aided by a webcam that‚Äôs embedded under the display, and that makes it slightly narrower and a lot shallower. It‚Äôs also thinner at 0.57 inches compared to 0.65 inches, and much lighter at 2.76 pounds versus 3.47 pounds. As we‚Äôll see below, part of that extra bulk is to support a cooling system suppressing the heat generated by a lot more processing power. So it‚Äôs a reasonable tradeoff if you want more performance and don‚Äôt care about a larger, heavier machine.
Both laptops are built very well, made of all-aluminum chassis. The OmniBook Ultra 14 has a lid that‚Äôs less flexible, but both laptops have keyboard decks and chassis that don‚Äôt give in to pressure.
The keyboards are actually quite similar, with large keycaps and tons of key spacing. The Yoga Slim 9i‚Äôs keycaps are more sculpted, but the switches on both are roughly equal in terms of being light and snappy with precise bottoming actions. I like these two keyboards a lot.
The touchpads are also similar, as mechanical versions that are large enough. The Yoga Slim 9i‚Äôs button clicks are quieter and more confident, but really, both laptops deserve the great haptic touchpads that both manufacturers use on some of their other laptops. Both have touch displays, which I prefer.
Connectivity strongly favors the OmniBook Ultra 14, which has a mix of legacy and modern ports while the Yoga Slim 9i only has Thunderbolt 4. And, Lenovo dropped the audio jack, which I don‚Äôt like at all. Both have equally up-to-date wireless connectivity.
The Yoga Slim 9i has a higher-resolution 32MP webcam compared to the OmniBook Ultra 14‚Äôs also high-resolution 9MP version. They both have great image quality, and both have fast Neural Processing Units (NPUs) that support the full range of Microsoft Copilot+ PC AI features. HP has more proprietary AI functionality, including its AI Companion suite, and the Poly Camera Pro software makes for a better overall videoconferencing experience.
Performance Mark Coppock / Digital Trends If the Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10 is the beauty, then the OmniBook Ultra 14 is the beast ‚Äî and it‚Äôs all down to their chosen chipsets. The Yoga Slim 9i uses Intel‚Äôs Lunar Lake, otherwise known as Core Ultra Series 2, which have eight cores (four Performance and four Low Power Efficient) and eight threads, running at 17 watts. It‚Äôs aimed more at efficiency than sheer performance, is is basically Intel‚Äôs new low-power chipset aimed at thin and light laptops. The OmniBook Ultra 14, on the other hand, uses the AMD Ryzen AI 9 lineup, and we reviewed it with the Ryzen AI 9 HX 370, which consumes 28 watts (configurable up to 54 watts) and has a whopping 12 cores and 18 threads.
As we can see from these benchmarks, the OmniBook Ultra 14 is a lot faster. Its integrated Radeon 890M graphics aren‚Äôt much faster than the Yoga Slim 9i‚Äôs Intel Arc 140 integrated graphics, so neither of these laptops is going to be great at gaming. Neither will have the GPU power to speed up tasks like video encoding, either. But for demanding productivity users, the OmniBook Ultra 14 offers a lot more power.
Geekbench 6
(single/multi) Cinebench R24
(single/multi/battery) Handbrake 3DMark
Wild Life Extreme Lenovo Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10
(Core Ultra 7 258V / Intel Arc 140V) 2723 / 10884 121 / 649 91 5397 HP OmniBook Ultra 14
(Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 / Radeon 890M) 2822 / 14608 119 / 1133 49 5886 Display Mark Coppock / Digital Trends The OmniBook Ultra 14 has one display option, a 14.0-inch 16:10 2.2K (2200 x 1400) IPS panel running at 60Hz. That‚Äôs fairly pedestrian today, particularly in a premium laptop. The Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10, on the other hand, has a spectacular 14.0-inch 16:10 4K+ (3840 x 2400) OLED display running at 120Hz. The difference is striking, with the Yoga Slim 9i‚Äôs panel being razor sharp and very bright, with brilliant colors and inky blacks. The OmniBook Ultra 14‚Äôs display just isn‚Äôt in the same class.
The difference is obvious when looking at our colorimeter results. The OmniBook Ultra 14‚Äôs IPS panel is pretty good as far as the technology goes, but you can‚Äôt beat OLED. Toss in the extremely high resolution, and it‚Äôs obvious which laptop wins this category.
Lenovo Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10
(OLED) HP OmniBook Ultra 14
(IPS) Brightness
(nits) 417 382 AdobeRGB gamut 96% 76% sRGB gamut 100% 100% DCI-P3 gamut 100% 76% Accuracy
(DeltaE, lower is better) 0.55 0.94 Contrast 28,790:1 1,310:1 Portability Mark Coppock / Digital Trends The Yoga Slim 9i is thinner, lighter, and smaller than the OmniBook Ultra 14. That makes it quite a bit more comfortably portable.
When it comes to battery life, though, it‚Äôs obvious that the Yoga Slim 9i‚Äôs gorgeous high-res OLED display has a price. Even though it has a larger 75 watt-hour battery compared to the OmniBook Ultra 14‚Äôs 68 watt-hour capacity, and even a more efficient chipset, it can‚Äôt keep up with the much longer-lasting OmniBook Ultra 14 ‚Äî at least, when you‚Äôre not pushing the CPU really hard as with our Cinebench R24 test.
For typical productivity work, the OmniBook Ultra 14 will keep you going for significantly longer without being plugged in.
Video Cinebench R24
Lenovo Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10
(Core Ultra 7 258V) 13 hours, 45 minutes 1 hour, 55 minutes HP OmniBook Ultra 14
(Ryzen AI 9 HD 370) 17 hours, 44 minutes 1 hour, 47 minutes Beauty or the beast? That‚Äôs your choice These are two very good laptops. They‚Äôre both well-built and attractive. But they‚Äôre aimed at different people. The Yoga Slim 9i 14 Gen 10 is thinner, lighter, and more elegant, while the OmniBook Ultra 14 is the brawnier and slightly less portable.
The bottom line is that if you demand faster performance and better battery life, the OmniBook Ultra a 14 is for you. But if you want a beautiful laptop ‚Äî and that includes one of the best displays I‚Äôve ever reviewed ‚Äî then the Yoga Slim 9i 14 is the better option.
Editors‚Äô Recommendations Lenovo‚Äôs gem of a laptop can‚Äôt quite outshine the MacBook Air The MacBook Air may have officially met its match The Lenovo Legion 9i is a 10 out of 10, and it‚Äôs $540 off today HP‚Äôs new 2-in-1 laptop packs a 3K OLED touchscreen We gave the Legion 9i a 10 out of 10 ‚Äî it‚Äôs $900 off today

author: VNExplorer
title: C√≥mo hacer atole de guayaba con piloncillo para d√≠as fr√≠os y nublados con la receta del chef Oropeza
text:
C√≥mo hacer atole de guayaba con piloncillo para d√≠as fr√≠os y nublados con la receta del chef Oropeza
Para d√≠as nublados o con fr√≠o, las bebidas calientes como el atole son imprescindibles, especialmente cuando son preparadas por la experiencia de tu mam√°. Pero si no est√°s cerca, te revelamos c√≥mo hacer atole de guayaba con piloncillo con la receta del chef Oropeza.
Como seguramente has notado, en M√©xico hay una amplia variedad de bebidas que forman parte de nuestras tradiciones, con ra√≠ces que se remontan a nuestros antepasados y que han perdurado a lo largo de los siglos, manteniendo sus t√©cnicas e ingredientes originales.
Ingredientes Para 4 personas
6 piezas de guayaba grandes en cuartos 1 taza de agua 1 ramita de canela chica 3 cucharadas de piloncillo rallado 2 cucharaditas de f√©cula de ma√≠z 1 pieza de an√≠s estrella 4 tazas de leche C√≥mo hacer atole de guayaba con piloncillo para d√≠as fr√≠os y nublados con la receta del chef Oropeza Dificultad: F√°cil
Tiempo total 25 m Elaboraci√≥n 25 m Pon a cocer las guayabas en una olla a fuego alto con agua, canela, an√≠s estrella y piloncillo hasta que est√©n suaves.
En un taz√≥n, combina 1 taza de agua con la f√©cula de ma√≠z y mezcla hasta que est√© completamente disuelta. Reserva.
Retira las especias de la olla en la que cocinaste las guayabas y transfiere el resto de la preparaci√≥n a tu licuadora. Licua a la perfecci√≥n hasta obtener una mezcla homog√©nea.
Cuela el pur√© de guayaba sobre otra olla, a√±ade la leche, mezcla y permite que la combinaci√≥n se caliente. Luego, agrega la mezcla de f√©cula disuelta y cocina a fuego medio, sin dejar de mover, hasta que la mezcla espese.
Sirve la mezcla caliente y disfruta.

author: Adam Bate
title: Man Utd 2-1 Rangers: Bruno Fernandes scores stoppage-time winner after Cyriel Dessers equalised late on
text:
Manchester United vs Rangers. UEFA Europa League.
Old Trafford.
Manchester United
2
- J Butland (52nd minute own goal)
- B Fernandes (92nd minute)
Rangers
1
- C Dessers (88th minute)
Man Utd 2-1 Rangers: Bruno Fernandes scores stoppage-time winner after Cyriel Dessers equalised late on
Match report as Bruno Fernandes scores a 92nd-minute winner to put Manchester United on the brink of progression to the round of 16 in the Europa League following a 2-1 win over Rangers at Old Trafford; Cyriel Dessers had cancelled out Jack Butland's own goal just minutes earlier
Thursday 23 January 2025 22:23, UK
Bruno Fernandes scored a stoppage-time winner for Manchester United as they beat Rangers 2-1 at Old Trafford despite Cyriel Dessers‚Äô late equaliser.
The Rangers forward had looked to have secured a point for the Scottish club in the 88th minute when he sensationally bested Harry Maguire to score a beautiful goal and cancel out Jack Butland's earlier own goal but Fernandes then volleyed in superbly to secure victory.
The points move United up to fourth in the league phase. For all their Premier League struggles, Ruben Amorim's side are unbeaten after seven fixtures in Europe and a result away to Steaua Bucharest next week will ensure a top-eight finish that bypasses the play-off round. Rangers, now 14th, look almost sure to be in it.
How it happened
It was Butland, a boyhood United supporter, who had looked to have provided the game's defining moment when he punched Christian Eriksen's corner into his own net early in the second half to seemingly undermine his side's spirited resistance.
But Rangers, who had the better chances in the first half despite Matthijs de Ligt having a goal disallowed, kept pushing for an equaliser. They found it through Dessers' dramatic finish to the delight of the vocal away support but there was a twist.
Amorim's comments at the weekend about this being the worst-ever United team had put the spotlight on the players but United showed character to find the winner. Lisandro Martinez's angled ball found its way to the captain, who made no mistake.
It was cruel on Rangers but it was also a much-needed magical moment at Old Trafford for a team that had lost four of their previous five games inside this stadium. Far from convincing, of course. But still capable of making this old stadium roar with delight.
